definition: to amuse oneself/to clown around/to provoke laughter
to stay/to stop/to tease (play with)/amusing/short pause in reading aloud, equivalent to comma (also written 讀|读[dou4])
music
happy/cheerful/to laugh
surname Yue
surname Le

sentences.english: AMUSE】The storyteller's jokes amused the children.
sentences.chinese: 说书人的笑话逗乐了孩子。

sentences.english: The mother was dancing the baby on her knee.
sentences.chinese: 那位母亲在膝上上下舞弄逗乐婴儿。

sentences.english: Bertha repressed her gaiety and began to eat .
sentences.chinese: 伯莎抑止住逗乐的情绪，开始吃饭。

sentences.english: The conjuror's magic delighted the children.
sentences.chinese: 魔术师的戏法逗乐了孩子们。

sentences.english: Pow!") and orgy-at-a-keep-fit-class music that accompanies it.
sentences.chinese: 和伴随进球时那种健身房式的音乐把我们都逗乐了。

sentences.english: Again we were in the park. The mothers looked slightly amused.
sentences.chinese: 我们再次来到公园里，妈妈们一脸给逗乐了的样子。

sentences.english: An inventor or teller of falsehoods; a liar.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们被故事讲述者的笑话逗乐了。

sentences.english: He devilled her during the tour.
sentences.chinese: 他在旅行中拿她打趣逗乐。

sentences.english: When the girls tease him,he doesn't quite know how to act up.
sentences.chinese: 姑娘们拿他逗乐时，他就没辙了。

sentences.english: He usually amuses us with strange stories.
sentences.chinese: 他常常讲一些奇异的故事来逗乐我们。

sentences.english: And populaces, like tyrants, require buffoons.
sentences.chinese: 而群氓和暴君都需要逗乐的小丑。

sentences.english: I was very much amused to see the seal perform its tricks.
sentences.chinese: 我被海豹得特技表演逗乐了。

sentences.english: The comedian tickled the crowd with his jokes.
sentences.chinese: 喜剧演员的笑话把人们逗乐了。

sentences.english: Read the activity listings page in the newspaper and choose some laugh-inducing events to attend.
sentences.chinese: 阅读一下报纸里的娱乐版选择一些逗乐项目来参加。

definition: to amuse/to cause to smile/amusing
to stay/to stop/to tease (play with)/amusing/short pause in reading aloud, equivalent to comma (also written 讀|读[dou4])
to amuse/to make sb laugh/to tease
to show off/to put on a show to amuse others
uproarious/hilarious/to split one's sides laughing/lit. to hold one's belly with both hands
cannot help laughing/unable to restrain a smile
to sway to and fro/to rock back and forth
to include impromptu comic material in opera performance (idiom); to jest/buffoonery
amusing/funny/entertaining
to do sth wacky/wacky/wacky behavior
to get people to laugh/funny/hilarious
(loanword) humor/humorous
uproarious/hilarious/to split one's sides laughing/lit. to hold one's belly with both hands
overjoyed (idiom); as pleased as punch
to amuse/to make sb laugh/to tease
humorous/jocular/zany
